title: US offers $10M reward for snitching on trio of Russians that hacked critical infrastructure
summary: The U.S. Department of State offered a $10 million bounty via the Rewards for Justice program for information related to a trio of Russian hackers.

title: Windows 11 August 2025 security update is causing unintended UAC prompts to appear for non-admin users — some apps are crashing
summary: Microsoft's latest Windows update for Windows 11, Windows 10 is causing unintended UAC prompts to appear in certain cases for non-admin users.

summary: Logitech will soon launch the company's new Signature Slim Solar+ keyboard, which features a solar panel to charge its battery.

summary: Linux Mint 22.2 ‘Zara’ has been released today, offering native fingerprint biometrics, an updated Sticky Notes app, and improved update management.

title: China injects tens of billions of dollars in chipmaking tools, but it's easily more than a decade behind the market leaders — Here's why
summary: China’s chip industry excels at mature nodes but remains at least a decade behind in advanced lithography.

title: Report says North Korea is also posting fake jobs to steal crypto — because using AI to get fake employees real jobs at US tech firms wasn't enough
summary: North Korea is reportedly posting fake jobs in the cryptocurrency sector as part of a bid to steal applicants' crypto assets.

title: Intel’s old NAND plant in China is now officially registered as SK hynix after US imposes new sanctions that limit fab upgrades in China
summary: According to Chinese registry filings, the plant's name officially changed to reflect its ownership by SK hynix on September 1.

title: AMD preps Mega Pod with 256 Instinct MI500 AI GPUs, Verano CPUs — Leak suggests platform with better scalability than Nvidia will arrive in 2027
summary: First details about AMD's next-generation AI rack solution emerge: three racks, 64 compute racks, 256 Instinct MI500-series GPUs, 64 EPYC 'Verano' CPUs, 18 switch trays.

title: Bill Gates’ 48-year-old Microsoft 6502 BASIC goes open source
summary: Microsoft BASIC for 6502 Microprocessor - Version 1.1 source code is now available on Github, under the MIT license.

title: Nvidia's next-gen AI chip could double the price of H20 if China export is approved — Chinese firms still consider Nvidia's B30A a good deal
summary: Chinese companies are hungry for more computing power and are willing to pay for it.

title: Noctua's first AIO liquid cooler delayed to Q2 2026, company reveals new roadmap — cooler was originally slated for a Q1 2026 release
summary: Noctua announced its first-ever mainstream AIO liquid cooler back at Computex earlier this year, where it said it would launch sometime in the first quarter of 2026. Now, thanks to an updated roadmap, we know that it's planned for Q2 2026. Noctua's AIO will be based on Asetek's G8 V2 pump design.

title: 'Doomer science fiction': Nvidia criticizes proposed US bill that would force it to give American buyers 'first option' in AI GPU purchases before selling chips to other countries — GAIN AI Act debuts in defense spending bill
summary: U.S. lawmakers have proposed the GAIN AI Act, a bill that would block exports of cutting-edge AI chips — like Nvidia's H100 and B300 — and require developers to prioritize American buyers before fulfilling foreign orders.

title: New 3D-stacked memory tech seeks to dethrone HBM for AI inference — d-Matrix claims 3DIMC will be 10x faster and 10x more efficient
summary: Santa Clara-based startup d-Matrix looks to replace HBM in AI inference with 3DIMC, or 3D digital in-memory-compute. The company's goals for the tech are to create a memory chip that is 10x more efficient and 10x faster than HBM in AI inference tasks.

title: Acer unveils Project Digits supercomputer featuring Nvidia's GB10 superchip with 128GB of LPDDR5x
summary: Acer announces its own version of Project Digits, named the Veriton GN100 AI Mini Workstation, that comes with Nvidia's GB10 superchip, 128GB of LPDDR5x memory, and supports up to 4TB of NVMe storage. The system is designed for AI developers who want an AI accelerator that is fast and compact for l…

title: Microsoft-backed research team builds hollow-core cable with lowest signal loss recorded in optical fiber
summary: Researchers from Southampton spinout Lumenisity have built a hollow-core cable with what they claim is the lowest signal loss ever in any optical fiber.

title: New 3D printing process could improve superconductors — scientists use 3D-printed ink and heat to create record-breaking surface area
summary: Scientists at Cornell have created a 3D printing process that can help improve superconductor performance with record-breaking surface area on compound superconductors.

title: Intel Panther Lake breaks cover in Acer Swift 16 AI — company also touts world's largest trackpad with stylus support
summary: The Acer Swift 16 AI debuted at IFA with support for Intel's upcoming Panther Lake processors.

title: Despite whispers of a bubble, OpenAI is planning a gigawatt-scale data center in India
summary: OpenAI is looking to ink closer ties with its second-largest customer market, India, with rumors that it is courting local officials in a bid to build one of the country's largest data centers for AI development and use.

title: Nvidia says its H100/H200 GPUs are not sold out, despite Jensen alluding otherwise during earnings call — company clarifies it has plenty of GPU supply
summary: Nvidia has released a statement clarifying that its H100 and H200 GPUs are not sold out, saying that it can meet demand for every order. title: German motorists facing ‘plague’ of electric car charger cable thefts – 70 charging points a day being gutted to sell for copper scrap
summary: Electric car charging businesses in Germany are scrambling to combat a 'plague' of cable thefts.

title: China subsidizes AI computing for small domestic companies — 'computing power vouchers' spread across multiple Chinese cities
summary: China is expanding its small and medium businesses' access to AI compute resources through the use of 'compute power vouchers' that subsidize the cost of training AI models.

title: Crucial T710 2TB SSD Review: A Subdued Lion
summary: The Crucial T710 is the successor to the flagship T705, offering only minor gains outside of outstanding power efficiency improvements.

title: ASML and SK hynix assemble industry-first 'commercial' High-NA EUV system at fab in South Korea
summary: SK hynix is the first memory maker to assemble ASML's High-NA EUV lithography system NXE:5200B at its M16 fab in Icheon to use it for R&D of next-generation process technologies before transitioning to full High-NA-based production later this decade.

title: Acer hedges its hardware bets, puts vPro and ECC memory in new high-end gaming laptop
summary: The Acer Predator Helios 18P AI straddles the line between gaming laptop and AI workstation, with an RTX 5090 and up to 192GB of ECC memory.

title: Acer's new Predator gaming monitor boasts a 720 Hz OLED panel, if you like gaming at 720p — 27-inch panel can also do native 1440p at a swift 540 Hz
summary: Acer’s Nitro family hits the mainstream segment with IPS and VA panels, while the new Predator X27U F8 is an OLED that goes after the premium sector.

title: U.S. gov't revokes TSMC's authorization to ship tools to its fabs in China — special export license to be pulled by end of 2025
summary: The U.S. will revoke TSMC’s special export license for its Nanjing Fab 16 by the end of 2025, potentially disrupting its 16nm and 28nm-class operations and shifting Chinese customer demand toward rivals like SMIC and HuaHong. However, SMIC vows to ensure uninterrupted operations of its Chinese fabs.

title: The Asus Prime RTX 5070 12GB is the absolute cheapest RTX 5070 available to buy, now only $523
summary: Now's the time to pick up a new GPU with Asus's Prime RTX 5070 GPU on sale for an all-time low price.

title: TSMC to reportedly raise quotes on advanced process nodes by up to 10% next year to pay for new fabs
summary: TSMC will raise 3nm–5nm chip prices by up to 10% in 2026 to fund new fabs and sustain margins as it expands 2nm production.

title: Amkor’s Arizona mega-plant could plug the holes in America’s chip ambitions — advanced packaging plant would reduce need to send US-produced chips to foreign shores for packaging and test
summary: Amkor Technology has confirmed it will build a $2 billion advanced packaging and test facility on a 104-acre site in Peoria, Arizona, with construction beginning imminently.

title: Planetary Minecraft-inspired demo uses a spherical planet — game has the same blocky mechanics, but converts flat earth surface into a sphere
summary: Software developer Bowerbyte built a game that had similar mechanics to Minecraft but relied on a spherical planet instead of a flat surface.
